Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with root of handle on right; interior glazed black; exterior: band in added red at rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of lion confronting a panther (part of lion's face remaining, and head, with added red on forehead and mane, and foreparts of panther); between the animals, three stacked chevrons with dab of red on each; small cross and dotted rosette as filling ornament; below, black band and glazed area.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 331, no. B379)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0756) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 7)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
